results.abstract: NASA says that space shuttle Atlantis will launch on schedule Dec 6 for mission to International Space Station after being cleared by review of all elements of flight (M)

headline.main: Review by NASA Clears Shuttle for Launching

results.snippet: The space shuttle Atlantis is to launch on schedule Thursday for a mission to the International Space Station, NASA managers said Friday.
results.lead_paragraph: The space shuttle Atlantis is to launch on schedule Thursday for a mission to the International Space Station after being cleared by a review of all elements of the flight, NASA managers said Friday. After an all-day meeting at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida, in which engineers reviewed and debated technical issues, managers decided that the shuttle and its seven-member crew could take off on Thursday.

results.abstract: Evel Knievel died on Friday, days after settling a lawsuit in which he alleged Kanye West stole his daredevil image in a music video. So the "College Dropout" has learned a lesson. When the rapper ages into his astronaut diaper years, he'd better not try the same stunt with Evel's last ride: Found here.

results.lead_paragraph: I always thought that someday everything would just make sense to me. It never happened. Should I have married my first-grade girlfriend? Should I not have? Ignorance is bliss.

results.abstract: National Aeronautics and Space Administration plans to send one last mission, in August 2008, to repair and upgrade Hubble Space Telescope; project astronauts are practicing at Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland and Johnson Space Center in Houston; spacewalking astronauts have refurbished Hubble four times in last two decades; photos; diagrams (M)

headline.main: One Last Ride to the Hubble

results.snippet: NASA plans to make a final set of upgrades and repairs next summer to the Hubble Space Telescope.
results.lead_paragraph: It's the last roundup for the People's Telescope. Next August, after 20 years of hype, disappointment, blunders, triumphs and peerless glittering vistas of space and time, and four years after NASA decided to leave the Hubble Space Telescope to die in orbit, setting off public and Congressional outrage, a group of astronauts will ride to the telescope aboard the space shuttle Atlantis with wrenches in hand.

results.abstract: Space shuttle Atlantis is poised for launching to International Space Station on 11-day mission that will make orbital outpost more international; goal of mission is to add European Space Agency's new Columbus laboratory to growing station; photo (M)

headline.main: Shuttle to Put European Module in Space

results.snippet: The space shuttle Atlantis is poised for a Thursday launching to the International Space Station on an 11-day mission that will make the orbital outpost more international.
results.lead_paragraph: The space shuttle Atlantis is poised for a Thursday launching to the International Space Station on an 11-day mission that will make the orbital outpost more international. NASA officials said Tuesday that the Atlantis and its crew of seven were ready for a liftoff at 4:31 p.m. as the space station passes over the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

results.abstract: Lani McCool, widow of Cmdr William C McCool, who died in 2003 when space shuttle Columbia broke apart just minutes before its scheduled landing at Cape Canaveral, prepares for final tribute to her husband at Naval Academy in Annapolis, MD; photo (M)

headline.main: Space Shuttle Widow Is Ready to Move On From Rituals of Loss

results.snippet: Nearly five years after her husband died when the space shuttle Columbia broke apart over Texas, the astronaut’s widow has decided to put her grief in storage.
results.lead_paragraph: By now, nearly five years after her husband died when the space shuttle Columbia broke apart over Texas just 16 minutes before its scheduled landing at Cape Canaveral, the astronaut's widow has a meticulous list of the things to pack for remembering him in public. The American flag that was draped over his coffin; the flight patch recovered from the shuttle debris in East Texas; the Tolstoy quotation he carried in his wallet, inscribed now over a laminated photograph of the seven-member crew; his T-38 flight helmet; portraits of him in his orange NASA suit; some of his many e-mail messages to her from his 16 days in space.

headline.main: Charge That Tee On My Platinum

results.snippet: A visit to Billionaire Boys Club and Ice Cream, which offers top-end hip-hop garb that is anything but subtle.
results.lead_paragraph: NEXT to the new Manhattan outlet of Billionaire Boys Club and Ice Cream is an antique store that is going out of business. ''Lost our Lease!'' and ''Everything 60% Off!'' is written in giant letters in almost every window. The dying wails of the antique shop overpower its new neighbor, which is kind of remarkable considering that BBC/Ice Cream, which opened in late November, offers top-end hip-hop garb that is anything but subtle. For instance, upon entering the heavy glass doors and nodding hello to the stern and suited doorman, you see on your right an $880 denim jacket with a shimmering image of an ice cream bar in Swarovski crystals on the back. It has eyeballs, and it is melting in blue drips. I spent a philosophical moment here, comparing a turn-of-the-century metal statue of a filigreed fairy in the antique store with this jacket, trying to decide which was more frivolous, and I concluded that life was totally meaningless.

results.abstract: Times Magazine's favorite ideas of 2007 include using bees to create honeycomb vase, finding that colostomy patients with some hope of having their bowels reconnected are significantly less satisfied with their lives than others with no hope at all, agent Scott Boras's argument that Alex Rodriguez's salary should reflect his projected contribution to Yankees' revenue over life of contract, musical theater's embrace of indie rock, finding way for Muslim to observe Ramadan while working on International Space Station, where there is no fixed sunset to end his fast and no clear way of bowing in prayer toward Mecca, Pres Nicolas Sarkozy's offense to his countrymen's idea of Frenchness by jogging daily in park, studying why strings spontaneously get into knots and finding that lap dancers earn more in tips when they are ovulating than at any other time in their menstrual cycle; photos; drawing (L)
results.snippet: HONEYCOMB VASE, THE [22] How many workers does it take to make a vase? To devotees of the Arts and Crafts Movement, it's one. But in the case of the Honeycomb Vase, it's 40,000 -- because the ''workers'' who made it were bees toiling in their hive.  ...
results.lead_paragraph: HONEYCOMB VASE, THE [22] How many workers does it take to make a vase? To devotees of the Arts and Crafts Movement, it's one. But in the case of the Honeycomb Vase, it's 40,000 -- because the ''workers'' who made it were bees toiling in their hive. The vase was conceived by Tom√°s Gabzdil Libertiny, a young Slovakian product designer. Eager to explore the relationship between design and nature, he settled upon beeswax as a suitable material and chose the vase as an appropriate object to make from it. ''Beeswax comes from flowers and, in the form of a vase, it ends up containing flowers before they die,'' Libertiny says. ''It's a beautiful story.''

results.abstract: NASA officials release 222 pages of e-mail messages related to case of astronaut Capt Lisa M Nowak, who drove from Texas to Florida to confront her romantic rival Capt Colleen Shipman for affections of Cmdr William A Oefelein; messages detail relationships and NASA's efforts to deal with public relations fallout; photo (M)

headline.main: NASA Releases E-Mail in Astronaut Case

results.snippet: NASA officials scrambled to decide how to handle the fallout surrounding Capt. Lisa M. Nowak, an astronaut who drove from Texas to Florida to confront a romantic rival.
results.lead_paragraph: NASA officials scrambled this year to decide how to handle the legal and public relations fallout surrounding Capt. Lisa M. Nowak, an astronaut who drove from Texas to Florida to confront a romantic rival, according to e-mail messages released Wednesday by the space agency. The 222 pages of messages also suggested a still-friendly relationship between Captain Nowak and Cmdr. William A. Oefelein of the Navy in the days before Captain Nowak drove to Orlando, where, the authorities say, she spritzed her rival, Capt. Colleen Shipman of the Air Force, in the face with pepper spray.

results.abstract: Rose Tani, whose son, Daniel M Tani, is astronaut now on board International Space Station--dies when her car is struck by freight train in suburb of Chicago (S)

headline.main: Astronaut's Mother Is Killed by Freight Train

results.snippet: The mother of a veteran NASA astronaut who is now on board the International Space Station died Wednesday when her car was struck by a freight train in a Chicago suburb.
results.lead_paragraph: The mother of a veteran NASA astronaut who is now on board the International Space Station died Wednesday when her car was struck by a freight train in a Chicago suburb, the police said. Rose Tani, 90, the mother of the astronaut Daniel M. Tani, was pronounced dead at a Lombard, Ill., hospital after the accident, the police said in a statement.

results.snippet: You didn’t hear them here first. But chances are that in 2007 you caught these phrases somewhere.
results.lead_paragraph: NEW words are most happily received when they arrive without fanfare. When they appear with ''ta-da!'' or ''look what I did!'' and are touted as clever or cute, they feel like impositions on our time. We resent that they exist mostly to exalt their makers. On the other hand, when we revel in new words it's often for the little jokes and puns implanted by their coiners. We delight in coining them, too, especially goofy throwaway blends in which two words combine syllables and meanings to make one. (How about ''bromance,'' a strong relationship between two heterosexual men, which combines ''bro,'' from brother, and romance?)

results.abstract: From the Week in Review's annual roundup: Illustration by Rick Valicenti + Thirst astronaut diaper n.
